html: Attempting to wear down the will of Hezekiah’s people in Jerusalem so that they will surrender, Rabshakeh denigrates every means of support they may be trusting in to protect them. While some indeed relied on Egypt’s chariots and horsemen ( Isaiah 30:2; 31:1), those who rely on Jehovah are never disappointed: “As a lion or a young lion growls over the prey when the shepherds muster in full force against him, and is not dismayed at the sound of their voice nor daunted by their numbers, so shall Jehovah of Hosts be when he descends to wage war upon Mount Zion and upon its heights” ( Isaiah 31:4).
